author: Louise Radnofsky
title: Alina Zagitova Outduels Evgenia Medvedeva for Gold in Figure Skating
text:
GANGNEUNG, South Korea—Alina Zagitova, a 15-year-old Russian, upended her compatriot, training mate and back-to-back world champion Evgenia Medvedeva to take gold in Olympic women’s figure skating Friday with feats of endurance thought impossible just four years ago.

Zagitova landed 10 triple jumps—all in the second halves of her short and long programs—this week at the Gangeung Ice Arena, including her “Don Quixote” free skate, each scoring a 10% bonus. That was enough to keep her one point ahead of 18-year-old Medvedeva,...
